replies.body:
It can take weeks/months to amass enough honor to move up a level. 
Don't worry, as long as you are playing and being sportsmanlike in all your games you will get there eventually.
Does your honors from mates in a premade count?

[> Can I game the system and boost to level 5 by constantly playing with a premade and honoring each other every game?](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008474148-Honor-FAQ)

That’s a great idea. Luckily, we’ve broken a few systems in our day, too. So we specifically built Honor so potential exploits like this give you (and your friend) literally no benefit.


In saying this I find it strange that they would exclude a whole subset of players (the ones that play with friends to avoid toxicity). You can submit a support ticket [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and double check with Riot support.

That statement from the FAQ can be open to some interpretation though (unless there's some Rioter statement about what it means precisely). From what I understand, Honours received from people you've queued with are just weighted differently so it provides "literally no benefit" when compared with earning Honours from normally matched players.

Yeah, the wording is a little vague. 

Taking into consideration what is written further down in the FAQ it is likely that premade honors are weighted differently. 

> How do I get a loading screen flair?

> First, hit level 3. Then **earn honor from two premade teammates_ or_ one stranger in one game**. The flair will unlock for your next matchmade game.

Riot support will be able to confirm this.

The way I understand it is that the honours you get in-game don't massively effect how much honour you earn. It's an incremental system that is based off consistency (i.e. playing games, not being a douche) and just naturally levels up over time. So there's no real gaming the system, just don't be a douche and you'll eventually level up.
